a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Change in agricultural labor and land use, 1961 to 2019
– Agricultural labor is measured as the number of adults whose main economic activity is agriculture. It includes
hired labor and unpaid family labor.
– Agricultural land use is the sum of croplands and permanent pastures for livestock grazing.
Data source: United States Department for Agriculture (USDA) Economic Research Service
